title: Energy suppliers to face tougher checks from watchdog Ofgem
text:
Energy companies face tougher tests to weed out risky businesses as the industry watchdog pledges to protect customers following a string of small supplier failures.

Existing suppliers will be forced to hand over audits of their customer service operations and financial status under new rules proposed by Ofgem.

The reforms follow 15 collapses of small energy suppliers since the start of 2018, including Solarplicity, Brilliant Energy, Our Power and Economy Energy.

Last month Eversmart became the sixth energy firm to go bust this year, leaving 29,000 customer accounts to be transferred to another supplier. Rutherford Energy, which served 280 business customers, ceased trading just weeks later....
